description:
This module implements some Excel 2003 statistical functions
 that cannot be implemented with standard XQuery functions.
 It uses Zorba specific functions.

functions.name: stdev
functions.description:
Estimates standard deviation based on a sample.
 The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed
   from the average value (the mean).
 It is computed with formula:
 sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / (n-1) )    = sqrt ( VAR(numbers) )
functions.summary: Estimates standard deviation based on a sample.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

returns.description: the standard deviation, as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: stdeva
functions.description:
Estimates standard deviation based on a sample.
 The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed
   from the average value (the mean).
 It is computed with formula:
 sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / (n-1) )    = sqrt ( VARA(numbers) )
functions.summary: Estimates standard deviation based on a sample.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

returns.description: the standard deviation, as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: stdevp
functions.description:
Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments.
 The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from
   the average value (the mean).
 It is computed with formula:
 sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / n )    = sqrt ( VARP(numbers) )
functions.summary: Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

returns.description: the standard deviation, as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: stdevpa
functions.description:
Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments.
 The standard deviation is a measure of how widely values are dispersed from
   the average value (the mean).
 It is computed with formula:
 sqrt( sum((x-average_x)^2) / n )    = sqrt ( VARPA(numbers) )
functions.summary: Calculates standard deviation based on the entire population given as arguments.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric The sequence can be of any length, from 1 up.

returns.description: the standard deviation, as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Value if the parameters cannot be casted to numeric type</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: subtotal
functions.signature: ($function_num as xs:integer, $numbers as xs:anyAtomicType*) as xs:anyAtomicType
functions.description:
Moved from math module.
 Returns a subtotal in a sequence of numbers.
 The function applied is given by $function_num.

parameters.name: function_num
parameters.description:
defines the function to be applied on sequence values. The possible values are:
1 or 101
AVERAGE
2 or 102
COUNT
3 or 103
COUNTA
4 or 104
MAX
5 or 105
MIN
6 or 106
PRODUCT
7 or 107
STDEV
8 or 108
STDEVP
9 or 109
SUM
10 or 110
VAR
11 or 111
VARP
In this implementation there is no difference between x and 10x.

parameters.name: numbers
parameters.description: the sequence of numbers or values castable to numeric. The sequence can be of any length.

returns.description: The function result, as numeric type

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">excel-err:Num if $function_num is not a value between 1 .. 11 or 101 .. 111</xqdoc:error>
